update.description:
Plugin that lists all components attached to an entity.

* All components are listed, even custom components from downstream users. 
* Some known components have their contents displayed, such as pose, vector, string, boolean...
* Component data is updated at the same rate as `Scene3d`'s
* The component type name and ID are displayed by hovering over the component name. This is meant to help plugin writers debug their simulations.
* The first version of the plugin is meant to be read-only, but some elements like `SpinBox` don't support being disabled. I may change them to plain text before merging this PR. A subsequent PR will add write functionality.
* Components that mark an entity's type, like `Model` or `Light`, are displayed up top with an accompanying icon. They don't show on the list below right now, but I wonder if it would be clearer for users if they did.

![CI_world.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2669212787-CI_world.gif)

![CI_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3177696299-CI_model.gif)

![CI_light.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1995952740-CI_light.gif)

![CI_joint.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3714013003-CI_joint.gif)

## TODO

* ~~Support custom units on `Vector3d.qml` so gravity and magnetic field display correctly~~
* ~~Add a `+` to the collapsible components?~~
* ~~Gather feedback on usability~~
* ~~I added some initial support for displaying the serialized data of unknown components, which should help downstream developers debugging their components. But many of them, like the ones coming from messages, look like garbage. This could confuse users. Maybe hide raw data behind a setting?~~ Removed raw data for now
* ~~Entity selection still needs to be sorted out, see pull request #515 and pull request #524~~
* Create custom widgets for more known types (material, geometry, inertial...) - coming up in follow up PRs
update.title: Component inspector

update.title: Component inspector

content.raw: Reverted in e8b187a because of ABI. The reduction of `AddComponentType` calls from the commit above should be enough to mitigate the issue for now.
content.html: Reverted in e8b187a because of ABI. The reduction of AddComponentType calls from the commit above should be enough to mitigate the issue for now.

update.title: Component inspector

content.raw: I was getting consistent shutdown crashes during `GuiRunner`'s destruction because it's often inside the `OnState` callback. I added a `Stop` method that terminates the transport node, as well as a mutex to make sure the node is only terminated after the callback is finished: 0767436
content.html: I was getting consistent shutdown crashes during GuiRunner's destruction because it's often inside the OnState callback. I added a Stop method that terminates the transport node, as well as a mutex to make sure the node is only terminated after the callback is finished: 0767436

content.raw: Swapped the play/pause icons in 0767436.
content.html: Swapped the play/pause icons in 0767436.

update.title: Component inspector

content.raw: Thanks! I'll change to that then.
content.html: Thanks! I'll change to that then.

content.raw: Although I understand the argument against having two buttons right next to each other with different behaviors, from what I’ve seen the standard is that if something is locked it shows the locked icon. Play/pause behavior is so ubiquitous I don’t think people will really be thrown off by the difference in behavior between those two buttons.
content.html: Although I understand the argument against having two buttons right next to each other with different behaviors, from what I’ve seen the standard is that if something is locked it shows the locked icon. Play/pause behavior is so ubiquitous I don’t think people will really be thrown off by the difference in behavior between those two buttons.

content.raw:
I changed both in 90419c7. But now the user gets conflicting information when looking at the UI. One play button means one thing, while the other means the opposite:

![play_button.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3615338300-play_button.png)

Now re-reading your message I understand you were suggesting to keep the play/pause consistent and only changing the lock. I'm not very sure about this either, because the 2 icons that are side-by-side have opposite behaviours. Thinking a bit more :thinking:
content.html:
I changed both in 90419c7. But now the user gets conflicting information when looking at the UI. One play button means one thing, while the other means the opposite:

Now re-reading your message I understand you were suggesting to keep the play/pause consistent and only changing the lock. I'm not very sure about this either, because the 2 icons that are side-by-side have opposite behaviours. Thinking a bit more

update.title: Component inspector

content.raw:
I honestly think the play/pause working differently from the lock and unlock is still fine.  I actually just noticed my phone has the lock button for a locked state and an unlocked lock for an unlocked state, but also we intuitively click play to play a video \(or simulation\).

I would advocate for the lock representing the current state, but can see the argument both ways.
content.html:
I honestly think the play/pause working differently from the lock and unlock is still fine. I actually just noticed my phone has the lock button for a locked state and an unlocked lock for an unlocked state, but also we intuitively click play to play a video (or simulation).

I would advocate for the lock representing the current state, but can see the argument both ways.

content.raw:
>  I would think the lock picture at the top of the plugin represents the current state and not the state that is to be transitioned to once clicked

Ah yeah I went back and forth with this. I actually started that way, and then it felt weird that the play/pause worked differently from the simulation's play/pause. So I changed it for consistency, but I agree it feels weird.
content.html:
I would think the lock picture at the top of the plugin represents the current state and not the state that is to be transitioned to once clicked

Ah yeah I went back and forth with this. I actually started that way, and then it felt weird that the play/pause worked differently from the simulation's play/pause. So I changed it for consistency, but I agree it feels weird.

content.raw:
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1491627768-Screenshot_from_2020-03-03_15-32-37.png)
Additionally the “Entity #” part seems a little squished to the side, possibly the spacing could be updated to leave some margin?
content.html: Additionally the “Entity #” part seems a little squished to the side, possibly the spacing could be updated to leave some margin?

content.raw:
Nice! LGTM, One small nitpick is that intuitively, I would think the lock picture at the top of the plugin represents the current state and not the state that is to be transitioned to once clicked.  From what I can remember this is how other similar interfaces work.

‌

It should be noted that when one uses the transform control plugin and moves a model, the component inspector spawns a new drop down category called “World Pose Cmd” that is updated to where the object is dragged to and the actual “Pose” dropdown isn’t updated until simulation is played.
content.html:
Nice! LGTM, One small nitpick is that intuitively, I would think the lock picture at the top of the plugin represents the current state and not the state that is to be transitioned to once clicked. From what I can remember this is how other similar interfaces work.

‌

It should be noted that when one uses the transform control plugin and moves a model, the component inspector spawns a new drop down category called “World Pose Cmd” that is updated to where the object is dragged to and the actual “Pose” dropdown isn’t updated until simulation is played.

update.description:
Plugin that lists all components attached to an entity.

* All components are listed, even custom components from downstream users. 
* Some known components have their contents displayed, such as pose, vector, string, boolean...
* Component data is updated at the same rate as `Scene3d`'s
* The component type name and ID are displayed by hovering over the component name. This is meant to help plugin writers debug their simulations.
* The first version of the plugin is meant to be read-only, but some elements like `SpinBox` don't support being disabled. I may change them to plain text before merging this PR. A subsequent PR will add write functionality.
* Components that mark an entity's type, like `Model` or `Light`, are displayed up top with an accompanying icon. They don't show on the list below right now, but I wonder if it would be clearer for users if they did.

![CI_world.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2669212787-CI_world.gif)

![CI_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3177696299-CI_model.gif)

![CI_light.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1995952740-CI_light.gif)

![CI_joint.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3714013003-CI_joint.gif)

* ~~Support custom units on `Vector3d.qml` so gravity and magnetic field display correctly~~
* ~~Add a `+` to the collapsible components?~~
* ~~Gather feedback on usability~~
* ~~I added some initial support for displaying the serialized data of unknown components, which should help downstream developers debugging their components. But many of them, like the ones coming from messages, look like garbage. This could confuse users. Maybe hide raw data behind a setting?~~ Removed raw data for now
* ~~Entity selection still needs to be sorted out, see pull request #515 and pull request #524~~
* Create custom widgets for more known types (material, geometry, inertial...) - coming up in follow up PRs

update.title: Component inspector

content.raw:
This PR now requires [this ign-gui PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/244/expose-qml-context-to-plugins/diff).

---

## Updates

### Lock to an entity

![lock.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2649762635-lock.gif)

### Pause updates

![pause.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2765055734-pause.gif)

### Other UI changes

* Larger header
* Alternating colors
* Pose and vector are read-only for now
* Correct units for `Vector3`
* `+` / `-` and highlight using accent color for collapsibles
content.html:
This PR now requires this ign-gui PR.

Updates

Lock to an entity

Pause updates

Other UI changes

  • Larger header
  • Alternating colors
  • Pose and vector are read-only for now
  • Correct units for Vector3
  • + / - and highlight using accent color for collapsibles

update.title: [WIP] Component inspector

update.description:
Plugin that lists all components attached to an entity.

* All components are listed, even custom components from downstream users. 
* Some known components have their contents displayed, such as pose, vector, string, boolean...
* Component data is updated at the same rate as `Scene3d`'s
* The component type name and ID are displayed by hovering over the component name. This is meant to help plugin writers debug their simulations.
* The first version of the plugin is meant to be read-only, but some elements like `SpinBox` don't support being disabled. I may change them to plain text before merging this PR. A subsequent PR will add write functionality.
* Components that mark an entity's type, like `Model` or `Light`, are displayed up top with an accompanying icon. They don't show on the list below right now, but I wonder if it would be clearer for users if they did.

![CI_world.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2669212787-CI_world.gif)

![CI_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3177696299-CI_model.gif)

![CI_light.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1995952740-CI_light.gif)

![CI_joint.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3714013003-CI_joint.gif)

## TODO

* ~~Support custom units on `Vector3d.qml` so gravity and magnetic field display correctly~~
* ~~Add a `+` to the collapsible components?~~
* ~~Gather feedback on usability~~
* ~~I added some initial support for displaying the serialized data of unknown components, which should help downstream developers debugging their components. But many of them, like the ones coming from messages, look like garbage. This could confuse users. Maybe hide raw data behind a setting?~~ Removed raw data for now
* ~~Entity selection still needs to be sorted out, see pull request #515 and pull request #524~~
* Create custom widgets for more known types (material, geometry, inertial...) - coming up in follow up PRs

update.title: [WIP] Component inspector

update.description:
Plugin that lists all components attached to an entity.

* All components are listed, even custom components from downstream users. 
* Some known components have their contents displayed, such as pose, vector, string, boolean...
* Component data is updated at the same rate as `Scene3d`'s
* The component type name and ID are displayed by hovering over the component name. This is meant to help plugin writers debug their simulations.
* The first version of the plugin is meant to be read-only, but some elements like `SpinBox` don't support being disabled. I may change them to plain text before merging this PR. A subsequent PR will add write functionality.
* Components that mark an entity's type, like `Model` or `Light`, are displayed up top with an accompanying icon. They don't show on the list below right now, but I wonder if it would be clearer for users if they did.

![CI_world.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2669212787-CI_world.gif)

![CI_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3177696299-CI_model.gif)

![CI_light.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1995952740-CI_light.gif)

![CI_joint.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3714013003-CI_joint.gif)

## TODO

* ~~Support custom units on `Vector3d.qml` so gravity and magnetic field display correctly~~
* ~~Add a `+` to the collapsible components?~~
* ~~Gather feedback on usability~~
* I added some initial support for displaying the serialized data of unknown components, which should help downstream developers debugging their components. But many of them, like the ones coming from messages, look like garbage. This could confuse users. Maybe hide raw data behind a setting?
* ~~Entity selection still needs to be sorted out, see pull request #515 and pull request #524~~
* Create custom widgets for more known types (material, geometry, inertial...)

update.title: [WIP] Component inspector

content.raw:
Thanks, I'll start working on these.

About the name, just to make sure I understand, you're not talking about the `Name` component (i.e. `left_wheel_joint`), but the header on the top, which contains the type and ID, right? I'll make it larger and add more padding.
content.html:
Thanks, I'll start working on these.

About the name, just to make sure I understand, you're not talking about the Name component (i.e. left_wheel_joint), but the header on the top, which contains the type and ID, right? I'll make it larger and add more padding.

content.raw:
Here are some UI suggestions:

1. The name of the component under inspection, such as "Joint   Entity 21", should have more emphasis than the properties. Right now the properties have a larger font and more spacing. 
2. Make a larger separation between the component under inspection and the start of the properties.
3. It would be nice to distinguish the different properties. For example, the property rows could have alternative colors, similar to the entity tree.
content.html:
Here are some UI suggestions:

  1. The name of the component under inspection, such as "Joint Entity 21", should have more emphasis than the properties. Right now the properties have a larger font and more spacing.
  2. Make a larger separation between the component under inspection and the start of the properties.
  3. It would be nice to distinguish the different properties. For example, the property rows could have alternative colors, similar to the entity tree.

update.description:
Plugin that lists all components attached to an entity.

* All components are listed, even custom components from downstream users. 
* Some known components have their contents displayed, such as pose, vector, string, boolean...
* Component data is updated at the same rate as `Scene3d`'s
* The component type name and ID are displayed by hovering over the component name. This is meant to help plugin writers debug their simulations.
* The first version of the plugin is meant to be read-only, but some elements like `SpinBox` don't support being disabled. I may change them to plain text before merging this PR. A subsequent PR will add write functionality.
* Components that mark an entity's type, like `Model` or `Light`, are displayed up top with an accompanying icon. They don't show on the list below right now, but I wonder if it would be clearer for users if they did.

![CI_world.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2669212787-CI_world.gif)

![CI_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3177696299-CI_model.gif)

* Support custom units on `Vector3d.qml` so gravity and magnetic field display correctly
* Add a `+` to the collapsible components?
* Gather feedback on usability
* I added some initial support for displaying the serialized data of unknown components, which should help downstream developers debugging their components. But many of them, like the ones coming from messages, look like garbage. This could confuse users. Maybe hide raw data behind a setting?
* Entity selection still needs to be sorted out, see pull request #515 and pull request #524
* Create custom widgets for more known types (material, geometry, inertial...)
